The Palayana Resort & Villas Hua Hin
8.6 Excellent
Based on 300 reviews

This is without Question a beautiful property. The rooms are large and stylish. The gardens and beach lovely The sad art is the details and the staff 1/ there is construction going in always a minus and especially when you go somewhere to relax.

The manager said only for 10 more days. I do wish Agoda would tell you this prior. 2/ the staff need way more training. English is not their first language but many of the staff in this hotel understand very little I asked for the manager to discuss my issues he turned up 24 hours later. The beachfront which was one of my attractions for staying here has mix match of deck chairs and without mattresses so not really comfortable The beach bar restaurant was without staff for 2 days and when they are there they don't come and ask you if you want food and drinks you need to go to them This is a beach for private use by hotel guests but the staff let anyone use the deckchairs. So not so private The food is expensive and small portions. Although the buffet breakfast is great however not enough staff to cope with a full hotel. Juices are empty tables not cleared etc. 3/ turn down service. Always s nice touch. But when they leave used yield in the floor and don't empty rubbish or dishes. Just a little sad All above basically comes down to management training and resources. All of which need addressed here There is a serious shortage of staff And The hotel also charges for a bucket of ice and the transfer to the town about 20 minutes away. Things that in a 5 star property should be inclusive Bonus is a great seafood restaurant called Cham View just 300m north along the beach. Also a great massage shack about 100 m north on the beach Hua hin town is quaint with cute French Spanish & array of great seafood restaurants. We'd love to go back once the staff is sorted

Show more
Peter , New Zealand
Dusit Thani Hua Hin Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 3970 reviews

if you look closely the resort it is showing a lot wear, water damage on the ceilings, rooms are in need of a fresh coat of paint and new wall paper too.

A bit of bleach wouldn't hurt either around the bath tub and showers. I didn't pay full price to stay here, and I wouldn't pay the full price from the hotel web site. I've stayed at many high end places and low end places and this is in between. It's like an up scale resort with la Quinta quality rooms. (Even La Quinta in the states have started mass renovations to keep their guest happy) Our room was a good size, the beds are nothing special usual hard mattress and the bathrooms need some deep cleaning. We ended up switching rooms because there were ants on the tables and by the door. In Thailand ants are very hard to get rid of, but in a hotel that is suppose to be this grand, I would expect better than this. Had to switch again because the ac wasn't working well... they couldn't fix that issue either

Show more
Bunyaporn , Thailand
Evason Hua Hin
8.6 Excellent
Based on 5393 reviews

The Hotel is around 20km south of Hua Hin. Taxi's down there are very expensive. A Shopping trip to the 7 Eleven Shop (2km), roundtrip for 10 Minutes 300 Bath.

To Hua Hin the cheapest we could get was 500 Bath one way. Evason Hua Hin is in Pak Nam Pran, this beach is not a swimming beach at all. To compensate for this the Hotel has a huge Swimming Pool for little and big people. Further South still on the Pak Nam Pran Beach, by Khao Kalok is a nice little swimming beach, unfortunately this beach is full of sandflies. Your body is burning for the next few days, not nice. Advantage of this hotel, it is close to many beautiful places to go, like Sam Roi Yot National Park. Prunburi Forest Park, and the Mangrove Forest is a must see, Wat Khaeo Daeng, Dolphin Bay, wonderful swimming Beach (14km south). The best beach is in Mueang Prachuap Khiri Khan it is called Ao Manoa Beach. This Beach is integrated in a Militaery Base. Sometimes they ask to see your passport, but this is all. The chairs at the beach are only 20 Baht per day. The beach itself is cleaned by the Militaery and looks fantastic. Food and drink are available everywhere. The trip to Prachuap Khiri Khan is around 60km one way from Pak Nam Pran. The Black Buddha is not very fare away either. The Winery is not that far away either. The view from the Restaurant is unexplainable. The food is excellent. Don't eat their Spagetthi, you wont find them on your plate. The Wine is wonderful. Evason Hua Hin is a top Hotel, the breakfast is out of this world. There is food everywhere, from Japanese, to Thai, French, Swiss etc. Normally it is included in your room or pool villa. If not it cost 650 Baht per person. I can recommend this hotel to anybody who is prepared the pay their price, but it is worth it.

Show more
Ruth , Australia
Hinn - Namm Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 4008 reviews

There is no consistency 6 rooms 3 cleaned 3 not no fresh towels even if you call you have to ask again 45 minutes later the rooms were ok 13 ppl 10 have food poisoning 3 didn't eat breakfast don't have it possible connection .

. The rating of the room was higher than needed to be pool was not ppl friendly the sand stone mix was to sharp to walk on into pool and tiles missing at bottom cut one child you may enjoy the bars all round playing music very late but I'm sure you may wish they stopped when your children cry about the boom boom boom sounds in there head. In all I wouldn't come back ever again but staff were nice friendly and the pool cleaners helpful but house keeping wasn't great and the kitchen staff didn't like there job good luck manager as you are at fault for not motivation or checks on staff

Show more
madeleine , United Kingdom
Cape Nidhra Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1486 reviews

2 of my friends and I had did a research and decided on staying at Cape Nidhra during our 3D2N visit to Huahin on 16 Sep 2015 (Wed) to 18 Sep 2015 (Fri).

We paid SGD722.76 for our garden pool room 312 for 3 pax via Agoda which I personally think is value for money. I believe all the rooms in Cape Nidhra has a private pool and its great! You can chill with a bottle of wine and have pool party with your friends after a day out walking. The room is large and generally clean. The bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is also very spacious with big bath tub and a separate rain shower. Yes the tub is big enough for two. Facilities in the hotel are also well maintain. There is a well equipped gym, steam room, sauna room and even a reading room! Breakfast was inclusive and the spread was ok. We had our dinner one of the night beside the pool at Rocks. The lady who had taken our order was actually quite rude and I'm not quite sure why. We wasn't very bothered about it so there was no feedback/complain made at that point of time. The food was average which cost 2060THB. We had: 1) Crab souffle with white wine served with vegetables 2) Baked Chicken with Hazelnuts, saffron and honey served with gratinated potatoes 3) Angel, Spaghetti with crabmeat, crab roe, white wine, olive oil, chili, garlic and rocket leaves Nevertheless, our stay was luxurious and we enjoyed it. Would definitely recommend Cape Nidhra to anyone who is visiting Huahin. But well, might want to skip the dinner. https://www.tripadvisor.com.sg/ShowUserReviews-g297922-d1941416-r327040977-Cape_Nidhra-Hua_Hin_Prachuap_Khiri_Khan_Province.html#

Show more
Shufen , Singapore
The Regent Chalet Regent Beach Cha-Am
7.8 Very good
Based on 1795 reviews

The rooms - we had 1 whole cottage and a half - are spacious with an effective AC, although sometimes smelly from outside.

The pool area is OK and the beach is extremely close: just behind the fence. With low tide you have ca. 10m beach, with high tide and a litte riugh wind, there is no beach at all and the concrete armouring of the surrounding walls and beach fortification are protruding from the sand. At an average you have ca. 5m of sandy beach directly at the hotel, but with a little walking it gets much more spacious. The internet is working in the public areas only and reasonably fast. So far everything has been fine and highly recommendable, except for the food. It actually never pays to try to accommodate all nations when it come to taste of food: Neither Chinese, nor European/Western nor Thai Food are then really good. Western Food is not what you know from home (cooked French Fries?), the Chinese Fod is missing the variety and the Thai Food is lacking the spices and taste we all love and the cocktails are uninspired. That was the main reason for us to go to the nearby village and eat out there for dinner. Maybe it helps to concentrate on excellent Thai dishes. All staff were very helpful, supportive and friendly! If we have the chance, we will definitely return.

Show more
Carsten , Germany
Rest Detail Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1335 reviews

Staffs are very attentive, check in and check out was a smooth process. location is good and easy to find provided that you bring your own car.

The hotel is roughly half way between the airport and Huahin town center so commuting is not difficult and won't take a long time. Breakfast is plenty so you won't run out of option if you stay for many days. There is one down side though, we brought out son to the beach for the first time and we picked beach villa. The hotel has beach sand separate from actual beach to prevent high tide. This is both good and not so good. It is safe for our son to play the beach sand without having to worry about the tide but at the same time the tude will be high the entire afternoon so we only have a few hours in the morning to take our son for a beach walk. But overall we're happy with rhis place and will probably come back again.

Show more
Warong , Thailand
Ayrest Hua Hin Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 3539 reviews

Cozy, relaxing, clean and peaceful hotel with spacious bedroom and bathroom. Room has a big balcony too.

Bedroom facilities are complete. Loved the swimming pool very much, nicely designed. Suitable for family. There were kids around but still it was very quiet there. I think the bedrooms are sound-proof, loved it. Everything was great except for the location i must say. It is located slightly further from the market and amenities. No walking-distance, only can take transport. They do provide scheduled shuttle bus, they only go to a few places though. Normal cabs like those we see in Bangkok are hardly found. Hotel called a Tuk Tuk for us, it was very pricey if compared to Bangkok. They charged us 250 baht for a single trip which was less than 8 mins. But in Hua Hin, it is recommended to take the green/white/orange color truck-like vehicle, it is a public cab, carries many passengers at once. This one is very cheap. Around 10-20 Baht per person. They go around the town and popular places. They stop at every stations. Lastly, breakfast choices could be improved. Would definitely recommend my friends and family to stay here. :)

Show more
vynncy , Malaysia
Amari Hua Hin
8.5 Excellent
Based on 2701 reviews

We stayed here for 5 nights as a friend was getting married in.Hua Hin. The Amari turned out to be a great find.

The room and hotel was clean and everyone was professional. The large pool was fantastic for both couples and family and it was nice to have a choice of food in the different hotel restaurants. It's location is slightly away from the centre but only about 10-15 minutes away by TukTuk so easy to go there if you want to. Only two minutes walk to the weekend night market which had loads of food options. Hotel breakfast had a good selection and staff were polite and helpful at all times. Would definitely recommend the hotel to friends. Only downside was the wifi was pretty patchy but overall we had a lovely time

Show more
Phillip , United Kingdom
Asara Villa & Suite Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 2461 reviews

I was a bit disappointed with the hotel for a few things: 1. The private pool is so small that I cannot beleive how a swimming pool in a 2 bedrooms villa is much smaller than the single room villa.

I pay more for the 2bedrooms villa coz' we want to have a bigger pool for the kids and the family to enjoy while we spent the holiday together. 2. The kids broke the glass accidentially, but I was being charged for the cup. I never had a hotel or a restaurant ask to pay for a broken cup. I was bit shocked. 3. The remote control was not working. 4. No hot water for the first night in 2 bedrooms villa in both rooms. 5. Massage and Spa was not available; it was fully booked. But, I do not see anyone doing the foot massage near the pool. Appreciated the assistance I have from Agodo when I do my booking. No matter what, it was a great holiday for me and my family.

Show more
Yuen , Hong Kong
Mida De Sea Hua Hin
7.6 Very good
Based on 2605 reviews

First off, it is not a resort as much as it is an incomplete serviced apartment. Located between the highway and beach, it was generally quiet and peaceful.

At check in, we experienced a very disinterested staff and not much of a cordial welcome. This is endemic in Thailand and this front desk was overall quite disappointing. For example, I had to ask where the room was rather than being told which building it was in. The duplex was large but felt empty. One side of the curtains did not retract, one sliding door was open a few centimeters and would not close and the upper windows were so covered in salty grime that it was nearly impossible to see out. Though there is little to see unless on a high floor. There is a tiny fridge, a small stove and sink but no plates, cookware or cutlery. Very odd. There is a sofa that folds into a bed but no linens. The rain shower downstairs did nothing but spray out the top. The bath upstairs, however, was pleasant. The bed was large but extremely hard and the air con blows directly on the bed. It was nice to have slippers and robes but beware as the painted steps can be extremely slippery. Breakfast was decent and restaurant staff was great. Security staff were friendly and professional as well. The place is not bad but needs some care and a bit of an identity. A confusing stay and I'm not sure we will return.

Show more
joseph , United States
Chalelarn Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 3209 reviews

First Things First: I'm not a tourist - I'm a foreign teacher teaching English and I've been in Thailand since 2014.

But I was a "tourist" in theory when I stayed at this hotel. My review will reflect my thoughts as a non-Thai but with my understanding that Thailand is NOT the same as America, my home country. VALUE FOR THE MONEY - I rated this a 4/5 because the Wifi was very unreliable during my Thai gf and my stay (Friday, Dec. 30 - Tuesday, Jan. 3 ~ 4 nights total). The Wifi is by AIS, which is one of the major wireless companies in Thailand. As a cellular company they are rumored to be the best; during my stay, the Wifi would cut in and out to the point my gf and I had to use our 4G mobile data connection. Early mornings Wifi was reliable but as tourist filled the rooms or came back or woke up the Wifi proved unreliable. Not a super big deal but this point and review is for folks who are new to Thailand. This Wifi situation is NOT common in Thailand so if you will stay here and for a long time, you might want to get a prepaid SIM (just a suggestion). Also on this same topic, the *free* included breakfast with our stay was a nice touch. Eggs, bacon, toast, yogurt, juice, cereal, etc. and a local Thai dish each morning. My gf and I ate breakfast every morning and while it was not super good it was delicious. I booked the room with "partial ocean view." I was on the 6th level and I had a very good view of the ocean. Partial yes but that is a very conservative word to describe it -- I had about 120 degree view of ocean view (in short, I had more ocean view then I was expecting). Very nice touch. LOCATION - 5/5 stars because it's across from a 7-11 shop, a short walk to the beach, a short walk to the main night market, etc. Across from the hotel, next to 7-11, is what I will refer to as a "Thai night market," meaning you can buy Thai food for like 40+ baht, which is a great price and won't break the bank. Also, this hotel is one block away from

Show more
Alan , United States
Ibis Hua Hin Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 4410 reviews

It was not expected for an international hotel like Ibis to have rude and snobbish staff that ruined our day.

We were in group of 10, so we gathered all passports for our 5 rooms. The receptionist, Annie, shove our documents to the side and told us to fill in all our particulars before checking in. I was frustrated, but went along with it. It was then I realized that the forms asking all our particulars from our address to passport number is of no use, because she have to photocopy all of our passport later on. Why the waste of time? We did not make such fuss, nor did we make an issue out of it but it still did took an hour to queue up twice and process the information before we get into our rooms. Never coming again.

Show more
lim , Malaysia
Radisson Blu Resort Hua Hin
8.7 Excellent
Based on 304 reviews

This hotel is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in my entire life. 1. We booked the room for 3 people and end up getting the room with 2 single beds and the white sheet and pillow on the hard sofa where the front office named "Nok" claimed to be a complimentary from the hotel.

This is not a complimentary since we paid the price for 3 people not 2. After many discussions with and help from agoda customer service , the hotel managed to put the proper extra bed in our room. Their staffs are not sufficient and not at all willing to help or provide proper solutions. So even we got the extra bed we decided to cancel the second night. 2. We asked for extra towels and was informed that they only have 2 left. (so we basically have to share) 3. They positioned themselves as a 5 stars hotel but we have to be in the queue for our breakfast because the hotel don't have enough tables. We asked the staff if this is the hotel's standard, they informed us that yes if it's a long weekend. Basically the hotel doesn't have the capacity to service all guests if they are fully booked.

Show more
Pimchanok , Thailand
Royal Pavilion Hua Hin
8.2 Excellent
Based on 3300 reviews

Disappointing despite high rating review in Agoda before chosen this hotel. I'd taken 2 deluxe suite rooms and 2 deluxe rooms for this visit.

Great location but the hotel only looks good from exterior. The toilet in the deluxe suite room gave out terrible smell/odor which is far from acceptable from a 4-star hotel. The shower water pressure is terribly low. Awful sleep with a super noisy air conditioning in the room, perhaps the vibration from the outdoor unit is causing the terrible discomfort etc. To make things worse, internet access is terrible in this 4-star hotel, unstable and really slow speed. Worst nightmare is the power failure in the morning right after breakfast, even lift wasn't working and seems staffs are not properly trained to react in such condition. Can even see security guard from the hotel trying to open the lift by using a "knife" ?? I'd then decided to get my family to use staircase for check-out despite power resumed after like 30 minutes later. Rather lift my heavy luggage through staircase then to use the lift as total lost of confidence in the hotel maintenance.

Show more
Tan , Malaysia
Asira Boutique HuaHin
8.6 Excellent
Based on 257 reviews

We stayed 3 nights in the 2 bedrm suite. Despite the cons, we had a great time in Hua Hin 😃. Pros- 1.

Friendly staff - they make an effort to attend to you though not all can understand english. 2. Small hotel so it is very peaceful and relaxing. 3. Room is clean and tidy. 4. Pool jus outside our room. 5. Transport no problem as hotel can call taxi for u. 6. Massage parlour opposite hotel was a plus. Cons- 1. Mosquitoes. We stayed ground floor. Best to bring along lemongrass spray, really help to keep it out. 2. Location not near shopping mall. Takes abt 15 mins to walk to hua hin market village. Will take longer with children and pram.

Show more
Karen , Singapore
My Vimarn Hua Hin
8.9 Excellent
Based on 172 reviews

Staff at hotel are really nice, always trying to help and sort out problems. Some speak ok english some hardly understand a word but keep trying to help.

We had a misunderstanding about the beach but the manager woman really was trying her best to sort it out. There is a shuttle to places down town or to one of the malls. The driver is really a nice funny person, always on time to pick you up back to the hotel. Pool outside is very nice with Sea view in front, kitsch music in the background, in a loop,(could be nice to stop the music loop once in a while). Indoor pool really nice for those rainy days, also quite and peaceful. Breakfast is good. Rooms are modern and new. We slept in the suite room 3 nights. Really big 2 rooms with separate door, nice sitting area and jacuzzi in the balcony facing the sea. Stuff always greet you (sometimes it is starting to annoy), and trying to help and serve you. Could be nice if they clean the pool from bugs and insects floating from the night. Hotel location is right on the beach within walking distance from cicada market, perfect location. Food prices are fairly priced. I must add that the 2 last nights we stayed, the hotel was almost fully booked and service level at breakfast for example was not that good. Also during the weekend breakfast had a lot of Thai and Chinese food with labels only in Thai , so westerners could not really eat it as you do not know what was it. Every night when we came back to our room there was a sleep well card with flowers on our bed,

Show more
Yoav , Israel
Chom View Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 2176 reviews

We loved it here. This is a hotel owned not by a chain but by the same Thai family for over 40 years.

Hisea Hua Hin Hotel is definitely a jewel of a find, for its highly detailed facilities, tasteful decor, furnishings, amenities, friendly and helpful staffs, and for the price! We've looked at many hotels in the area prior to visiting Hisea Hua Hin Hotel and nothing beats Hisea Hua Hin Hotel for what it offers, the price, location, and the staff. Being that it's brand new, it's absolutely immaculate! Although it's low season and therefore it's not fully booked, I see housekeeping clean every rooms everyday! The beds are the most comfortable we've ever found during our 3 months of travel in Asia, and the owner accommodates our needs to the best that he can. Case in point, I wanted an electric fan in my room due to my special need for it, and he happily obliged without question although the A/C in his hotel works perfectly. The staff are very attentive and helpful, and the owner is a hands on kind of a businessman. He's always around and can easily be reached and easy to talk to. 7.5 Very good
Based on 935 reviews

We took the slightly pricier Villa at the hotel, which came with access to the beach (Takes less than a minute to walk there).

The room was clean and beautiful, though filled with mosquitoes when we first entered. The beach itself was good; the hotel provides deck chairs and umbrellas. Nearby you can get massages on the beach, buy some fruits or drinks (either from the hotel or from the paddlers that roam the area). Most of our time was spent sitting down by the deck chairs, enjoying the sea breeze and warm sea waters. The lodge is around 3-4 mins walk from the main road, and the road is serviced by the SongTeow(Akin to a bus which costs 10 Baht per person). The SongTeow will take you to Cicida Night Market or into town center for the HuaHin Night Market. Either way, we were pleasantly surprised and this saved us quite a fair bit instead of taking the TukTuks (Which would have cost 160-180 Baht/trip. If you are cost-conscious, skip the villa and take the normal rooms(which are alot more reasonably priced), as you'll most likely be spending time on the beach or taking the SongTeows to explore Hua Hin. Btw, breakfast is an ala carte buffet; you can order as much sets as you want. The French Toast is good, and I overheard the next table asking for additional bacon on my last breakfast at the hotel. Go for it. The bacon is worth it.

The place is just OK to stay at, with rooms looking tired (and that was apparently the "new" building), most visibly in the bathroom area, which has seen better days.

The "new" building is also at the back of the hotel, facing the main road, and has entrance of its own, without any sign of security. It feels more like an apartment than a hotel. View from one side is of the road and hills in the distance, and from the other side of... another building. Bathroom amenities were somewhat limited, so I guess convenience stores around the hotel sell a lot of what's missing. There is a water kettle and hair dryer in the room. Perhaps there was also an iron, given there was a warning that using iron on the board invokes 5000 baht penalty for ruining it. Breakfast is passable but certainly nothing to write home about. The dining area, which is mostly outside, between parking lot and the pool, has quite nice decoration and constant breeze. Unfortunately the wind comes from parking lot side, where most smokers gather. Ash trays in supposedly non-smoking rooms show hotel doesn't care much about this. The tiny "forgot phone charger and T-shirt at home" shop at the entrance is a nice touch, if only there wasn't Family Mart 50m away. Lobby is hot if sitting near the windows due to direct sunlight and no air conditioning. WiFi was offered for free across all areas, and password was in folder in the room. Seen it but didn't use it so I don't know how useful it would have been. Staff is wonderful, across the board. But does this qualify it as a 4 star hotel? Most certainly not. Maybe 2 star, 3 at most. When comparing to other 4 star hotels I've stayed at, this place isn't even in the same league.

Anyway, for persons who don't travel with the personal car may find it hard to deal with since it is kind of far away from town and the road to hotel at night is secluded and very dark. Brilliant family holiday, travelled with a 6, 3 year old and 8 month old baby. Close to the town and resturants to eat out with the kids, we ate out every night payed extra for the club so the kids could top up with snacks and drinks throughout the day when their tiny stomachs started to groan.

Breakfast was full of variety with made to order options. We booked a pool villa, ask for one not overlooked by the Hilton and away from the restuarant. We put the kids in the second room and put the baby monitor in with them so we could have our own space (albeit with our baby) in the main pool villa and it worked brilliantly. The pool had a wall so my fear of kids falling in was quickly avoided. The night market was great fun, lots of bartering and gifts, street food to be eaten, we also visited the Elephant Safari, Black Mountain waterpark (all via Tuk-Tuk) and Night markets which our kids all enjoyed. The staff were great with the kids and us, kids club good, pools great. The beach isn't the best Thailand has to offer if you are really after that white sand and blue water experience but you can get a tuk-tuk up the road to a better one (its much better than the UK beaches and great for sandcastles, pony rides and again exploring).

Veranda Resort Hua Hin Cha Am - MGallery By Sofitel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 970 reviews

The positives; The staff is mostly wonderful, genuine and friendly. The pool area and the water is wonderful, to look at, to walk around and swim.

But then you have to ask yourself two questions; 1. is this 4 or 5-star material all throughout? and 2. is it worth the money? We had the jacuzzi room in a building at the opposite side of the street, on a corner with another street. That is not advertised, but it is good to know you need to walk a little. There are low- and mid-tension lines above ground running through your view if you are on the 4th floor. You look mostly down on all the wiring on the 5th and you’ll look over it on the 7th floor. But you have a good chance of not seeing any ocean and looking at electricity wires... Doesn't fit the positive feng shui description. The room is spacious, though dated. The cabinets don't stay closed, there is some deposit around the shower floor as well as the jacuzzi that could do with a good steam clean, and it just isn't 4-star material. More a reasonable 3-star room. No M Gallery material for sure! Is it worth it?! It tells you on Agoda that you got a special price from the normal rate of 500 USD/night. That is of course an absurd price. The price I paid was close to 250 USD/night incl. taxes. That's not cheap and looking at options elsewhere (Koh Samet), I would not be a repeat customer for this price. It just isn't worth it. More a 130 - 150 USD room. Accor, if you call something 4 stars or M Gallery material then you need to make sure it is up to that standard. I will now have a different view of Accor quality standards after this experience, which is a pity because I'm also a business traveller staying frequently at hotels of the presumed 4 star class. You should aim for honest and transparent standards to give your guests that 4-star experience whether that is in Europe, the US or Thailand.

Sea Breeze Guesthouse
7.6 Very good

I really liked the Sea Breeze Guesthouse, the rooms are clean and the one I stayed in had a view of the sea and beach, which was brilliant to watch the sunrise.

In fact, the Sea Breeze is right on the sea front, simply get up in the morning, eat breakfast and step out onto the beach in the morning. The location is very quiet and is really in a small village between Cha Am and Hua Hin, so it might be convenient to have your own transport or you may find you are spending a lot on taxis. The beach front is haveing a lot of work building up sea defences at the moment, but it is easy to still walk along the beach and find a nice little spot. The Staff are all very friendly and extremely helpful, it was almost like staying with friends. I enjoyed the breakfasts and morning coffee sitting in the open area, overlooking the sea. The little village has some places to eat ranging from Thai to European food, and a few bars and massage shops, and the inevitable but convenient 7eleven. Everyone in the village is friendly and I would often just stop and pass the time of day chatting, but it's very quiet and relaxing in the evenings. I would consider staying here again and I would recommend Sea Breeze Guesthouse to my friends or anyone looking for a relaxing few days break. Just be aware that you may need to use taxis occasionally or hire a motor-bike for a few days if you don't have transport of your own.

Hua Hin Paradise Boutique Guest House
6.8 Good
Based on 116 reviews

The best thing about this guesthouse is the location, very central for those who like to stay in a central location like myself, only minutes walk from the beach, night market and entertainment district.

The building is a strange design, tall and cylindrical, consequently you can look out of the room from both sides and view the outside world. The rooms are situated on a west- east orientation, so with windows on both sides the sun blasts into the rooms at sunrise and sunset from opposite directions. This was a negative point for me, the late afternoon sun was ok but I wasn't keen on the early morning sun shining in the room at 6am in the morning. The rooms are reasonable and the bathrooms are quite spacious. The hotel has a lobby and an outdoor patio on the first floor facing out onto the street with seating and tables. The problem is, the staff are maudlin and unwelcoming so one doesn't feel the inclination to be around them. After a few minutes of lounging on the patio I began to feel like an intruder and beat a hasty retreat. The bathrooms have a built in soap and shampoo dispensers installed but the soap dispenser was empty and there was only a tiny bit of shampoo in the shampoo dispenser so take your own soap if you do decide to stay here. I only stopped one night but the next morning I have numerous sizeable bites and welts on my torso. This could have been a mosquito or it could have been bedbugs, so I'll reserve judgement, but my partner was unaffected so a mosquito was the most likely cause. In my opinion this guesthouse is very average but bearing in mind it's budget accommodation one can't expect too much. It would have been better if the staff were friendlier, don't expect too many smiles if you choose to stay here. There's better options in the same price bracket in Hua Hin but there's also worse ones.

More about Hua Hin / Cha-am

Hua Hin is one of Thailand’s most sought-after vacation destinations. The opening of Hua Hin Airport gives travelers the option of flying in, although Hua Hin is only a three-hour drive from Bangkok.

The main beach area is Hua Hin Beach, which features high-rise hotels and trendy resorts with bungalows and chalets on either side. Life on this beach couldn't be more relaxing. A bus from the waterfront links to a mountaintop temple with commanding views of the resorts in Cha am and Hua Hin as well as the surrounding countryside.

Hua Hin is becoming increasingly cosmopolitan and boasts first-rate restaurants and nightclubs. Tourists can follow lazy days on the beach with exciting nights on the dance floor.

As the resorts in Hua Hin continue to garner more international attention, savvy travelers have been moving on to quieter areas down the coast. Among these areas is the boutique resort district of Pranburi, a rising star among domestic tourists. For a complete escape from the city, travelers can head to Sam Roi Yot National Park, where the scenery shifts between tangled mangrove forests, gorgeous beaches, and dense forests.

Find out where the hotels, attractions, and must-see destinations of Hua Hin are located by exploring the interactive map on this page.

The opening of Hua Hin Airport gives travelers the option of flying in, although Hua Hin is only a three-hour drive from Bangkok. The main beach area is Hua Hin Beach , which features high-rise hotels and trendy resorts with bungalows and chalets on either side. Life on this beach couldn't be more relaxing. A bus from the waterfront links to a mountaintop temple with commanding views of the resorts in Cha am and Hua Hin as well as the surrounding countryside. Hua Hin is becoming increasingly cosmopolitan and boasts first-rate restaurants and nightclubs. Tourists can follow lazy days on the beach with exciting nights on the dance floor. As the resorts in Hua Hin continue to garner more international attention, savvy travelers have been moving on to quieter areas down the coast. Among these areas is the boutique resort district of Pranburi, a rising star among domestic tourists. For a complete escape from the city, travelers can head to Sam Roi Yot National Park , where the scenery shifts between tangled mangrove forests, gorgeous beaches, and dense forests.
